ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:0.5_0: 12. The training rule on evasive speech
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa was misbehaving. Then, when he was examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, he spoke evasively,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.3_0: “Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.5_0: “How can Venerable Channa speak evasively like this when he is examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha?’”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.6_0: ‘Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.7_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you are speaking like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.8_0: ‘Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.11_0: “... Foolish man, when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, how can you speak evasively like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.12_0: ‘Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.13_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.15_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.16_0: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should charge Channa with evasive speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.17_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.18_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.19_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.20_0: The mendicant Channa is examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.21_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should charge him with evasive speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.23_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.24_0: The mendicant Channa is examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.25_0: The Sangha is charging him with evasive speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.26_0: Any monk who approves of charging him with evasive speech should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.27_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.28_0: The Sangha has charged the monk Channa with evasive speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.29_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.30_0: Then, after rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.31_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.32.1_0: ‘If a monk speaks evasively, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:1.33_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.1_0: At that time Venerable Channa was examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, spoke evasively,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.2_0: “By speaking evasively I’ll commit an offenses,” and he instead harassed the Sangha by remaining silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.4_0: “When he’s examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, how can Venerable Channa harass the Sangha by remaining silent?’”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.5_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you are acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.8_0: “... Foolish man, when you’re examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha, how can you harass the Sangha by remaining silent?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.9_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.11_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.12_0: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should charge Channa with harassment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.13_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.14_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.15_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.16_0: The monk Channa is examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.17_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should charge him with harassment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.19_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.20_0: The monk Channa is examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.21_0: The Sangha is charging him with harassment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.22_0: Any monk who approves of charging him of harassment should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.23_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.24_0: The Sangha has charged the monk Channa with harassment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.25_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.26_0: Then, after rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.27_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:2.28.1_0: ‘If a monk speaks evasively or harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.2_0: when being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, he speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying, “Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.4_0: when being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, he harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.4_1: this is called “which has been harassment”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.5.1_0: If he has not been charged with evasive speech, but he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.6_0: “Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.7_0: If he has not been charged with harassment, but he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.8_0: If he has been charged with evasive speech, and he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then speaks evasively because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.9_0: “Who has committed an offense? What offense has been committed? In regard to what has an offense has been committed? How has an offense been committed? Who are you talking about? What are you talking about?” then he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.1.10_0: If he has been charged with harassment, and he is being examined in the midst of the Sangha about an action that was the basis for an offense or about the class of an offense, and he then harasses the Sangha by remaining silent because he does not want to talk about it or reveal it, then he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he speaks evasively and he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he speaks evasively and he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he speaks evasively and he harasses, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.4_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.5_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they is unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.2.6_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.2_0: if he asks because he does not know;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.3_0: if he does not speak because he is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.4_0: if he does not speak because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.5_0: if he does not speak because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.6_0: if he does not speak because he thinks the legal procedure will be illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done to one who does not deserve a legal procedure;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc12:3.3.9_0: The second rule, the training rule on evasive speech, is finished.
